title: 2001 Arab Club Champions Cup
text:
The 2001 Arab Club Champions Cup edition, called Prince Faisal bin Fahd Cup, was won by Qatari side <a href="Al%20Sadd%20SC">Al Sadd SC</a>, the hosts. It was the 17th tournament and was held from 28 November to 12 December 2001.
Preliminary Stage.
Zone 1 (Gulf Area).
Qualification from <a href="GCC%20Champions%20League">GCC Champions League</a> held in <a href="Al%20Ain">Al Ain</a> on 2001.
"<a href="Al%20Ain%20FC">Al-Ain</a> qualified but withdrew the tournament, <a href="Al-Rayyan%20SC">Al-Rayyan</a> replaced it"
Zone 2 (Red Sea).
The qualifying tournament took place in <a href="Jeddah">Jeddah</a>.
"<a href="Al-Ahli%20Saudi%20FC">Al-Ahli Jeddah</a> and <a href="Al-Ahli%20Sana%27a%27">Al-Ahli Sana'a'</a> advanced to the final tournament."
Zone 3 (North Africa).
"<a href="MC%20Oran">MC Oran</a> advanced to the final tournament."
Zone 4 (East Region).
The qualifying tournament took place in <a href="Amman">Amman</a>. <a href="Nejmeh%20SC">Nejmeh</a> was disqualified from the qualifying tournament because the <a href="fifa">fifa</a> has frozen the activity of the <a href="Lebanese%20Football%20Association">Lebanese Football Association</a>.
"<a href="Al-Faisaly%20SC%20%28Amman%29">Al-Faisaly</a> and <a href="Hutteen%20SC">Hutteen</a> advanced to the final tournament."
Final Tournament.
Group Stage.
The eight teams were drawn into two groups of four. Each group was played on one leg basis. The winners and runners-up of each group advanced to the <a href="%23Knock-out%20stage">semi-finals</a>.
Group A.
<onlyinclude></onlyinclude>
Group B.
<a href="Al-Faisaly%20SC%20%28Amman%29">Al-Faisaly SC</a> withdrew from the tournament after the first match after contesting the referee falsely, the result was annulled.<br>
<a href="Al%20Rayyan%20SC">Al Rayyan SC</a> replaced <a href="Al%20Ain%20FC">Al Ain SC</a> who withdrew from the tournament.
